inn1.comm: good length delivery, not a lot of nip, but calmly pushed to mid-on
hurried on middle-and-leg stump, a bit of climb off the seam. Defended easily enough
that's a statement of intent. A fraction too short from Anderson, and no great venom in the delivery. Watson rocks back and clobbers that through midwicket
that's a good riposte. Yorker, and well dug out
zipping off the seam, clatters the thigh pad as Watson aims to flick through square leg
better line and length, drawing a solid defensive block on off stump
good ball, on off stump, full length
a bit of a nothing delivery, slipping down leg
outside off, full length again, angled into the gully
too full this time, an easy half-volley, and Paine punches coolly through long-off. Elegant
Bresnan responds by pulling his length back by half a yard. Blocked off the back foot
another lifter on off stump, angled into the gully
a touch of width,  but no more than dabbed out to point. Another decent over
outside off, no stroke offered this time
that is a nut. Outside off, kicking off the turf, and just feinting past the edge. Good delivery
dabbed down to third man, a decent line once again, but just enough width to open the face
flicked off the hips to backward square
the first out-and-out short ball of the game, and it's pulled without total control to deep square. Safe enough
short, but without the same conviction, and Watson's pull is miscued to midwicket
outside off, through to the keeper
outside off again, and a loose nibble in response. Nearly an edge
a swished pull,  but no contact. Loose again, and loud oohs as Kieswetter gathers
pushed back into the crease, and defended
right up in the blockhole, and lo and behold, it's blocked
more kick off the turf, but that's misdirected, and helped calmly through backward square leg for another boundary
drawn onto the front foot, blocked again
tight line, good carry, left alone
poked into the gully, sharp fielding and a threat of a shy keeps Paine in his crease
bouncer, and a brisk one. No stroke offered on this occasion
that's an ugly premeditated stroke. Gave himself room and aimed a wild swing through the covers. Anderson held his line and beat the edge
off-stump lifter. Defended to bring to an end a tidy over
open-faced glide down to third man. Effective use of the width
banged in short, too short.
forced back into the crease by a tight delivery, back of a length
Paine goes right back in his crease, and Bresnan follows him with a yorker. Good canny bowling
dabbed into the covers, and another dot ball piles up to keep Paine under the cosh
that's a good release of pressure. Not a bad delivery, but played firmly on the up, and through the covers
that's wild, and ugly. A smear over the covers, and he just clears Anderson running back. Bresnan is not impressed, and informs the batsman as such
blocked. Tight bowling from Anderson, no width at all
big inside-edge as Anderson nips one off the seam from a good length. Half an appeal
flashed down to third man, just a single
third man is in business again as Watson flashes another single through the cordon
another single to third man. Just a touch too wide from Anderson, but Australia can't capitalise
a good finish to the over, a big offcutter, and it nearly worms its way through Watson's defences. Nearly, but not quite.
that's a better stroke, as Bresnan serves up another rare half-volley. Good stride, full face, and there's no catching that
back of a length, swished through point
that's a pie from Bresnan, short and wide, and Paine slams it gleefully through point. A costly over so far
better this time, tighter line, and respectfully defended
down the track, lofted drive, good contact, and mid-on can't get close to that. A third four in five balls
short, and swung away over fine leg. A hint of a top-edge, but they all count. An expensive over, but Paine is up and running, so too are Australia
tight from Anderson, defended into the gully
punched drive, tidied up by mid-on
driven back to the bowler, full and straight from Anderson
a hint of width, but carved only as far as point
targeting the base of middle stump, but whipped wristily to midwicket for a quick single
outside off, a hint of wobble through the air, defended to point. Another fine over from Anderson, who's been the pick of the attack this morning
full and straight, punched back down the pitch
chipped to mid-on, and a scampered single as the shy comes in. Home safe
short and leg-sided, it would have been wide if it had been left alone, but instead it was helped on its way by Paine, who is now flying
down the leg-side again, another four, much finer this time. Poor work from Broad
open-faced steer to point.
a firm-footed plant, and chipped into the leg-side
tucked off the toes to midwicket
big stride, and solid defence, into the covers
bouncer, no stroke offered
solid stride, and pushed into the covers
turned off the toes, but without any power
impeccable over, tight line and length, no liberties on offer
good start, full and straight, and defended
an ambitious swipe through the line, no timing in the shot, but enough bat to steal a single to mid-on
a desperate gallop as Swann's shy comes in from fine leg. But he's safely home
full stride, and pushed up to cover
slower ball, and that was picked straight from the hand. Watson drops to one knee and mows it over midwicket. Top tonking
strays onto the pads, and a tidy over is suddenly transformed into an expensive one. Fourteen off the over as that shot fizzes through the gap at wide mid-on
that one went like an offbreak, and nearly nipped out the off stump. Good delivery
too short, and that's spanked on the up through backward point. Australia are cooking now, and England need to think on their feet, as they did to good effect at Cardiff
fuller length, and defended to cover. That's a better length for this wicket
poor bowling, speared down the leg-side
better line and length once again
tucked off the toes to square leg
inside-edged defence to bring an end to a mixed over
looped onto a good length to launch his spell
clipped coolly to midwicket

that is absolutely plumb! Paine steps back for a flick through midwicket, but is beaten by the angle from wide of the crease and nailed right in front of middle. That's the breakthrough, and not before time from England's point of view
wide of the crease again, and played watchfully
Collingwood comes in at silly point as Ponting drives
off the mark with a punch into the covers
right up in the blockhole, defended to mid-on
width and lift, Ponting cracks one off the back foot, but it's swiftly fielded at point
this one nips back off the seam a fraction. Cautiously defended into the covers
drilled into the covers, but can't pierce the field
shorter, and Ponting attempts his signature pull, but he can't time that one
full and straight, that's a tidy maiden of the Wag variety, or should I say, Fuf?
outside off, chopped down to short third man
very full from round the wicket, dug out down to mid on
ooh, another appeal for lbw but this one is strangled as it's going down leg on the angle
comes forward and defends
worked off leg stump stump past midwicket as he finally beats the field
outside off, leans forward in defence and pushed into the covers
nicely done, waited for it and opened the face through short third man who makes a good chase and keeps them to two
same shot and more reward this time, a little too wide from Swann and it gives Watson the room to tab it fine through third man
straighter and Watson goes back to whip this through midwicket
nicely bowled on off stump, Ponting comes forward and pushes to the leg side
goes back and pushes through the covers
can't beat square leg this time as he turns this from the stumps...Swann just taking a little while to settle
pushed firmly into the covers
leans forward, opens the face a touch into the off side
dragged down very short and helped through the leg side out to deep square
another short one, but it hurries onto Watson who has to be quick to pull it to midwicket
defended out to midwicket
that goes all the way, too short and Watson had all the time in the world to wait on the back foot and pull it over deep midwicket...a good way for Australia to go to drinks
worked from outside off into the leg side

gone! Huge wicket for England and great work from Kieswetter as this one spins sharply down the leg side, beating Ponting as he comes down the pitch and the wicketkeeper brings the ball back from very wide with the Aussie captain stranded well out of his crease
comes forward on off stump and defends
too short outside off, Clarke uses the crease well and steps back to cut through point
worked out to midwicket
whipped from outside into the leg side but can't find the gap
short and pulled away through the leg side but picks out the man at deep midwicket
goes back and punches into the off side
wide outside off but it only costs a single as he cuts out to deep cover
too short again, gives Clarke plenty of time to force it through the covers
ooh, almost another but this drops just in front of short third man as Watson cuts without the placement he wanted
driven down the ground to long-off to bring the 100
waiting on the back foot, cut through point out to the sweeper
ooh, well bowled, went for a double bluff and pitched it up...Clarke's footwork not there and he gets a thick inside edge out to deep square
handsome...floated up outside off stump, a slower ball and it's driven dismissively through cover. He loves that shot.
punched down the ground to long-on and there's another fifty for Watson, this time from 54 balls. Now, can he convert one?
there we go, the expected bouncer, but it's too short and going down the leg side
back of a length, Clarke hops back and defends into the off side
he's not too comfortable with that one, goes for a pull and it takes his arm then into the body
well bowled, but Clarke is easily behind it on his tip-toes and defends by his feet
fired way down the leg side
chopped fine to short third man
very quick outside off, cut away and a good piece of fielding from Strauss prevents any runs
defended down by off stump
floated in on middle, punched with a straight bat down the ground
works this off the stumps and he's placed it well between deep square and midwicket so it allows two
very full, dug out and fielded by the bowler in his follow through
that squares up Watson and takes the outside edge down to third man as he tries to play through the leg side
short ball and pulled away with a mixture of a hook and a pull to find deep square
back in his crease, dropped into the off side and backward point is quickly in
good line from Broad, on off stump and Watson is all defence back to the bowler
nice drive, beats Broad as he dives across but mid-off is up and keeps them to a single
back of a length, forced into the off side
good fielding back the non-striker's stumps...that was drilled straight by Watson and crashed into the timbers. Saved four, and also saved umpire Ian Gould from having to get out of the firing line
onto the front foot and defends
quicker ball and does Watson who has to jab down to avoid being bowled
misses out on a pull and is taken on the body
latches onto the pull this time, but hits it quite straight and one bounce to long-on
pushed gently into the leg side
whipped along the ground through midwicket and the deep man is quick to keep them to one
uses his feet, almost yorks himself and just digs it out down to long-on
full outside off, heaved through the leg side but doesn't find the gap and picks out deep midwicket
down the pitch, Swann responds by dragging the length back and Clarke defends to the covers
more turn for Swann, beats Clarke's defensive push and into the pads
flicked in the air through midwicket but just wide of the fielder inside the circle
angled down the leg side, tucked through short fine-leg and they scamper back
steps back and cuts through the off side...Clarke is very good and using the crease against spinners
on off stump, driven down the ground
on middle and off, defended down the pitch
short and punched down the on side, beats Yardy's dive
full on leg stump, worked out to deep midwicket
turned from off stump to square leg
flicked down to long-on
uses his feet, worked away through midwicket
nicely tossed up on off stump, Watson comes forward and defends to cover
quicker this time and too straight, flicked out to deep square and he hurries back for a second

gone! Swann makes another breakthrough and Watson again can't convert...he tries to turn this into the leg side, it all looks quite innocuous, but some extra bounce meant he just lobs a simple catch to square leg
down the pitch and defended to midwicket
worked down to long-on with a whirl of the bat
outside off, defended square on the off side
full on middle, defended back to the bowler
nicely onto the back foot, driven through the off side and the timing is so good that he beats three fielders into the boundary...that was very elegant from a batsman known for brute force
fired in quicker, defended to silly point
down the pitch, worked from outside off to long-on
outside off, comes forward and defends
pushed back to the bowler
swept firmly from off stump out to deep square-leg
back into his crease and turned straight to square leg where Watson was caught
beaten this time as he tries to glide to third man
and he starts with a short wide ball which is spanked through the off side...not a great start for Bresnan
so close! Bresnan finds the outside edge this time but the ball doesn't quite carry to Kieswetter, much better line and White was trying to fiddle it to third man
tucked out to midwicket
driven hard off the back foot but straight back to Bresnan who fields well
tries to work into the off side but just ends up popping it back towards the bowler
beaten this time as he tries to drive off the back foot so a good comeback from Bresnan after that early boundary
tossed up high, and clipped straight to midwicket
sharp turn, but can't find the gap as it's helped round the corner
fully forward and watchfully blocked
a nudged single into the leg-side
solidly forward
rocks back, and plays against the spin to backward point. Tidy bowling
back of a length, and that's flat-batted into the covers, and just short of mid-off. Ugly stroke
flighty stuff from Clarke. Another swish, and a spiralling top-edge lands safe at backward square
more confident this time, a firm pull to deep midwicket
stroked out to extra cover.
tucked up on leg stump, clipped to midwicket
full and straight, poked to cover.
up on the toes, rocks back, and cut firmly to deep point
swept fine, down on one knee and effectively played
drawn forward, and pushed to mid-on
quick footwork, and another thumped cut
big stride forward, blocked with a full face
sharp delivery to finish - flatter, faster and tweaking significantly. Defended
fearsome start! Well, not really, but it's a good stump-to-stump delivery, and Clarke all but chops on
tidy line and length, no liberties on offer as yet
solidly forward, head over the ball, and defended
looped up, driven calmly to mid-on
punched back up the pitch, it ends up clipping the non-striker's stumps, but no danger
that's a very tidy start, defended  back down the pitch
swept, and snaffled at square leg! A full-blooded stroke, but Strauss scoops the ball low to his left, and that's a key wicket!
round the wicket, and Hussey is in all sorts of trouble, playing for the spin but nearly chopping the straight one onto his timbers
another squeakingly close delivery, outside off, and snaking past the stump as Kieswetter whips off the bails for good measure
this one turns, straightening on middle stump. Wily work
poked uneasily to slip, all along the ground
a wicket maiden, and that's magnificent. Deflected to gully
outside off, and slapped to backward point
round the wicket, floated up, and driven to cover
tidy again from Collingwood, driven straight back into his midriff
clipped off the toes, picked up at midwicket
tossed up, right into the blockhole, driven to cover
flicked from outside off to short midwicket. That's a fine over, and it's also time for drinks
speared down the leg-side, raps the pad
pushed right back into the crease, sharp pace
that's a cracking stroke, a murderous mown slog-sweep, reminiscent of his blows in that epic T20 semi-final
forward and blocked to cover
forward and defended, back to the bowler
good finish to the over. England have got a bit of a stranglehold at present, but as Hussey briefly demonstrated, the shackles can yet be broken
round the wicket, and that was worth an appeal as it was definitely pad first. Just outside the line though
outside off, punched into the covers
tossed up, Clarke mets it on the half-volley with some urgent footwork, and clipped to wide mid-on
speared into the blockhole, squeezed out to point for another quick single
a hint of width, and panned out to point. Australia are content to trade in ones for the moment
pre-meditated sweep, but he makes a hash of that. Loud appeal for lbw, but that struck him outside the line again. Still, uncomfortable times for the batsmen
finds the gap for another single
chopped out to deep point
tossed up, and clipped to midwicket. No liberties on offer at the moment
oh dear, that was out from the moment he went through with the stroke. Done in the flight, and Clarke's uppish drive picks out the sub, Ian Bell, at long-off.
forward, and defended into the gap at cover for a single
tossed up outside off, mistimed drive, and no run there. A superb spell comes to an end
cramped for room on off stump, defended to gully
round the wicket, and looped into the blockhole. Defended to cover
deflected backward of point for another single
that's a very tidy stroke, reverse sweep, and picks the gap expertly. Valuable runs
valiant work from Pietersen on the deep point boundary, but his foot is touching the rope.
worked off middle into the leg side
gone and another one departs...Collingwood strikes with an off cutter that scoots through on off stump and beats Hussey's push. That had been coming.
opens his account straight away as he punches down to long-on
worked off the stumps down towards fine leg
very full and flicked straight to square leg
again turned to square leg to end a successful over
worked into the leg side
driven straight down to long-on
tucked off leg stump wide of short fine-leg
another one tucked into the leg side, this time out to deep square
touch too straight and helped into the big leg-side spaces again
excellent work in his follow through as Yardy dives full stretch to stop a well-timed drive
there's some aggression as this is heaved from off stump through the leg side and both midwicket and mid-on are inside the circle
dropped into the off side and well run
no timing from Hopes as he tries to force off the back foot and it dribbles to long-on
more 'turn' for Collingwood as this beats Smith's flick and takes the pad into the off side
nice lap wide of short fine-leg
can't beat midwicket where captain Strauss makes a one-handed save
starts with a full toss on leg stump but Smith can only force it through the leg side for a single
back of a length, worked through deep midwicket and good running makes it into a couple...Australia's 200 is up
excellent yorker, not much Hopes can do except dig it out
another good yorker, this time he manages to work it down to long-on
stays full and pushed down the pitch, but Anderson fumbles the stop in his follow through and is very annoyed as it gives away a single
gone! Anderson strikes with a slower ball which was back of a length and makes Hopes play the pull far too early, resulting in an under edge onto off stump...now it's down to the bowlers
short and pulled away through midwicket
goes for the yorker, comes out a low full toss which is worked out to deep square
back of a length, pulled out to deep square who is quickly in from the boundary
connects well with this pull but it goes straight to deep midwicket
and that's why it's all short, because it works, as Harris splices an attempted pull and lobs a simple catch Strauss at midwicket who has been in the action today
short on leg stump, takes Bollinger on the back side as he doesn't play a shot
low full toss which is drilled down to long-on...England won't mind that
he goes over the covers and clears the in field, Luke Wright chases hard and a better throw could have had Bollinger in trouble as he came back for three
brilliant yorker, Smith tried to give himself room but was followed by Anderson
another goes! Anderson gets his second as Smith goes for a sweep and is taken on the heel of his back foot which looked in line with leg stump
good yorker, dug out towards the keeper and they scamper a single
all over! Dead-eye yorker from Anderson as Bollinger backs away to try and go through the off side and the ball strikes bottom of middle. That is that.

inn2.comm: rapid first delivery, outside off, and no stroke offered. Tidy and threatening start
fizzed down once again, late swing after the ball passes the bat. No stroke
width, and toe-ended down to third man to get Strauss off the mark
now there's no answer to that! Stunning delivery, a late-swinging yorker, and Kieswetter's middle stump is out of the ground!
another yorker-length delivery, but outside off this time. Prodded away uncertainly. 96.7mph, apparently!
full length, and driven, but without any timing. What a start
a strangled appeal as Strauss shapes to flick down leg. Going down
attempted pull, but no real contact
Strauss swings into another pull, but the ball is long gone by the time he completes his shot

driven firmly into the covers, Ponting takes the pace off with his fingertips, before Steven Smith hauls it back in with an insanely committed head-first dive. Lucky there wasn't a speaker in the way of that effort
a juicy half-volley, but KP rifles that straight to cover
outside off, and left calmly alone
good batting from Strauss, put bat to ball and stole an instant single to keep the strike rotating
slower ball, and Pietersen punches that back to the bowler
right into the blockhole again, but forewarned is forearmed for Pietersen. He was ready for that delivery, and dug it out with ease
flicked off the toes, well timed, but Ponting at midwicket defies his ageing limbs to field with a tumble
too much width on that one
pushed back into the crease, and defended to midwicket
bouncer, and Strauss ducks. Good aggression
defended with a dead bat, and the ball plops down at Pietersen's feet
outside off, KP thinks about having a dart, but thinks better of it. As well he might. Plenty time in this innings
strikes the pads on leg stump, and balloons into the covers
good wheels from Bollinger, still no stroke
left alone once again
a solid over, tight line and no rushing from Pietersen
nice start, bursting past the edge with good carry. Nearly the breakthrough
fetch that. Over-pitched, and pumped through the covers. Well waited, that's the first boundary of the innings
full again, but short extra intercepts another firm drive
outside off, shaping away from the left-hander, no stroke offered
right up to the bat, dug out to mid-off
on the hips, nudged square
outside off, and bending back into the left-hander
firmly blocked out to cover
short, and Strauss sways out of the way
banged in short, takes the glove and deflects down to the slips. England's slow men made the difference in Australia's innings, but the Aussie quicks are bowling well so far
full length, attacking the stumps, and defended again. Solid work
swinging down the leg-side, strikes the pad
lovely strike, just a touch of width and rifled through point. No stopping that
punched into the off side
cracking strike, beautifully timed on-drive, he saw that alright!
worked off leg stump out to deep square
angling across Pietersen and left alone
ooh, Pietersen walks across the crease and misses his whip as the ball passes over middle and leg
left alone outside off
a touch of width, angled out to point
angled delivery, strikes the pad but always going over. Strauss thinks about a single but is rightly sent back
banged in short, and with fine leg up, Pietersen was never going to miss out on that. Even with fine leg back he'd have climbed into it! And Harris is annoyed with himself
overpitched to compensate, and Pietersen is onto that in a flash, a sweetly struck on-drive. Two in two

nippy delivery, and Pietersen is nipped in the bud! That's gotta hurt ... and sure enough it does ... he's down and taking a breather. The physio is out, but as David Lloyd points out, what exactly can he do? Give him a rub?
pushed back into the crease, and defended into the covers
that's too good, steps out and across, and helps the ball round the corner. A costly over, and England's chase is up and running now
short, and through to the keeper
tucked into the gap, another run to the cause
that one kicks a touch, and Pietersen is surprised as he plays it down off the glove
half a stride forward, and defended into the covers
outside off once again, a very measured run-chase so far
rising delivery on off stump, no stroke offered there
driven, off a slight inside-edge, to midwicket
ungainly, but effective. Hopes drops short, so Strauss cross-bats him straight back over his head. Undefended, and four
attempted steer out to backward point
outside off, dabbed down to third man
width outside off once again, nurdled away
driven on the up, not entirely convincing, but it lobs over the infield and rolls away for another boundary
big shout, and that looked exceptionally close! Massive appeal, but a touch outside the line?
tucked out to square leg
replays suggest Strauss was more than a bit lucky with that lbw appeal
picks the gap with a calm drive
Strauss returns the compliment
big stride forward, and defended
bouncer, and a quick one. Strauss ducks
outside off, zippy pace, fizzes past the edge
short and quick, and Strauss is unsettled as he sways back to pull. Gets enough bat on it in the end. Pretty close to treading on his stumps though!
clipped up to mid-on
caught and bowled! That was sharp reactions as Pietersen drove hard back at the bowler's face. And he got his right palm in the way just in time ... game on, perhaps?
down the leg-side
fine delivery, late-swinging yorker, shovelled out to midwicket
big stride and smothered on the line of off stump
forward once again and defended
down the track, full swing of the blade, straight into the crowd at long-on. Shot
flicked out to midwicket
on the pads, flicked fine, Harris chases and intercepts with a slide
too much width outside off stump, and that's battered past point, as Strauss waited and waited, then belted it
pushed back onto the stumps, and defended again
misdirected, down the leg-side
punched drive, out to mid-off
crunched out to cover, from a full length
banged in short, and Collingwood ducks
down the leg-side again. The radar's gone a touch here
full and straight. Defended with a vertical blade
flinched out to point from back in the crease
round the wicket, defended into the covers
down the leg side, clipped away through backward square
back of a length, defended towards mid-on
goes for a drive, gets an inside edge and it rolls dangerously into his boot and almost towards the stumps
worked away out to deep square
opens the face and glides it down to third man...all England need to do is tick the score over
tries to work this to the leg side and misses
width outside off and Strauss runs it down to wide third man
back of a length, pushed out to midwicket
fuller outside and driven to cover
turned into the leg side, can't beat Ponting at midwicket
keeps the strike with a guide to third man
wide outside off, allows Collingwood to free his arms as he drives through cover and the sweeper does the fielding...turn into a bit of a flat-bat drive
inside edge into the pads as Hopes tries to replicate Collingwood's success with medium-pace cutters
pushed off the back foot to mid-off
sweetly timed drive down to long-on
round the wicket, tucked out to midwicket
outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man
worked from off stump with the angle from round the wicket out to deep square
defended off the back foot to cover
fuller on off stump, punched back to Harris
that's easy for Collingwood, half volley on leg stump is clipped neatly between deep square and fine leg
leg stump line again, tucked away with Collingwood's trademark nudge to fine leg
on off stump, defended to point
on off stump, comes forward and defends
tossed up nicely on middle with a hint of drift, pushed into the covers
goes back and drives off the back foot to long-off
goes for a sweep from outside off and gets a bottom edge that rolls backwards past the stumps
worked in the air wide of the bowler and down to long-on
quicker ball on leg stump, worked out to deep midwicket
outside off and driven hard to short cover
driven up to mid-off
on middle stump and flicked in the air over midwicket and it beats long-on into the boundary...well timed by Collingwood
sensible batting as he now opens the face and gets a single third man to rotate the strike
beaten outside off as he tries to steer to third man again
full on the stumps, Strauss uses the angle well and places it through midwicket
tucked off leg stump out to deep midwicket
pushed across outside off, Strauss leans forward and pushes to cover
touch short and allows Strauss to go back and cut, it probably goes finer than he wanted but comfortably beats short third-man
worked away into the off side
pushed easily down to long-off
played into the covers and Strauss goes for a wander before deciding against the single which is a wise move
round the wicket, driven down the ground and brings up England's 100
over the wicket, on off stump and defended to the leg side
drilled down the on side past Clarke to long-on
easily pushed down to long-off to bring up the fifty stand between captain and vice-captain...very steady stuff
worked off the back foot square through the leg side
comes forward and defends on middle and off
defended off the back foot, playing with the hint of turn to the on side
drives into the covers with an open face and it's a quick single
driven down the on side, bowler and non-striker get into a tangle but midwicket does the fielding
uses his wrists to work into a gap at midwicket from a leg-stump line
round the wicket, Strauss misses his flick and there's an appeal for lbw but it's well outside off
goes for a sweep from well wide of off stump and doesn't make contact
out comes the reverse sweep but he picks out short third-man
uses his feet and bunts it through straight midwicket
well played, a full ball and he opens the face to find a gap at cover...clever batting
this time Strauss pushes into the gap at cover and that takes him to his second consecutive fifty, this one from 68 balls
pushed into the leg side
uses his feet then flicks it off his toes out to deep square-leg
oh, well bowled...this is quicker and skids at Collingwood who is caught on the back foot
comes forward and defends
worked into the leg side
beats short midwicket with a drive down the ground
a little short, worked around the corner to short fine-leg
opens the face and pushes square on the off side
nicely pulled away off one leg out to deep square
a surprise bouncer, Collingwood goes for the pull and doesn't really connect which might actually save him as the ball falls short of deep square-leg
full outside off and pushed to cover
down the leg side and all that need was a touch as Strauss flicks it down to fine leg
wide outside off and Strauss misses a flamboyant drive
more width but Strauss doesn't time his cut and it bounces to Clarke at backward point
full on off stump, nicely driven through the covers to the sweeper
round the wicket, whipped down to long on
onto the back foot and work away through square leg
onto the front foot and again finds the gap easily to the sweeper
the bowler fields in his follow through from a straight drive
pushed into the off side to end a tidy over but Australia need more than tidy overs
big appeal as this is speared down the leg side, but Aleem Dar has none of it and calls wide. Strauss's bat was nowhere near it
on middle and worked out to midwicket
boy, that was a quick bouncer and Strauss bails out of any thoughts of a hook shot...Paine had to leap to take it
slower ball very full outside off, pitches in the footholes and Strauss leaves alone
angled out to backward point and can't beat Michael Clarke
fuller outside off, defended with soft hands and it bounces backwards towards the stumps
back of a length, defended back to the bowler
onto the back foot and punched to a very straight and short midwicket
on middle and defended to the off side
down the pitch and clubbed away through midwicket to cries of 'catch it' but it's clear of everyone as deep midwicket collects
drifts outside leg stump and it's nicely paddled way by Collingwood through short fine-leg
misses out this time as he tries to work into the leg side
tossed up on leg stump, pushed firmly out to deep midwicket

Gone! The change works immediately as Collingwood pushes with no great certainty outside off and chops the ball onto his stumps. It was on a length, wobbling around just outside off and he just pushed his bat at it without conviction.
full and nudged to midwicket, and Morgan is off the mark straight away
flashed square on the up, but the cover sweeper runs round and hurls the ball back quickly
back of a length, outside off and Morgan leaves well alone. That appeared to seam away a touch as well
much fuller this time, Morgan leans forward and tucks to midwicket, but straight to the fielder and hit too well to risk a quick single
driven hard on the off side this time, but again he picks out the fielder - at cover
very full to start, dug out to midwicket
Harris pulls the length back but pushes this one wide of off and Strauss carves out to deep cover
punched through the covers off the back foot, and they amble through for one
driven to mid off, but that hit the bottom of the bat and was trickling along when it reached the fielder
full again, wider this time and Morgan drives out to the cover sweeper
very full to finish, Strauss jams the bat down to keep the yorker out
rising fairly sharply off a length, Morgan was in some difficulty but managed to keep the ball down as he paddle-pulled to fine leg
wide and very short outside off stump, Strauss sways his head out of the way but he needn't have moved. Bollinger lucky not to be called for that one
angling in to the pads this time and Strauss glances to fine leg's right. As the fielder runs round they push for two
on the spot, pitching just outside off on a length and angling in. Strauss defends to cover
speared in at leg stump, this was there to be hit but Strauss couldn't get anything on it and the ball thumps into his pad - was going way down leg so no appeal
Bollinger pushes Strauss back in the crease to finish, defended to point off the back foot
short, but the ball didn't get up very high and Morgan pulls out to deep square leg
back of length, Strauss aims the punch through cover but inside edges onto his thigh pad. That didn't bounce too far from the stumps as it came down...
hammered. Short, decent pace on the ball but Strauss is just too good on the pull and crunches this authoritatively out to the deep midwicket boundary
chopped to point
leg-stump half volley and Strauss clips easily out to square leg
well left by Morgan, as Harris slants one across him
pitching on a length just outside off, and moving away off the seam a touch. Strauss drops the ball defensively towards point
short and rearing up to Strauss's grille, but he's in good touch and hooks the ball infront of his face and out to long leg. Great shot, he was in a good position and got a solid connection
short again, but wide of off this time and Strauss ducks out of the way this time
more back of a length stuff, Strauss hops onto the back foot and taps the ball back towards the bowler
Bollinger fires this one in very full as Strauss shuffles right across to off and clips down to fine leg. It would've been interesting if he'd missed that...
short outside off, angled down to third man
tight start, on a length and outside off, angling in and tapped back to the bowler

what a hit! Where did that come from? Morgan just wondered down the wicket, catching the ball on the half-volley and lifting it easily back over Hopes's head and several rows back into the crowd at long-off.
nudged down to third man
nicely played, off the face of the bat and intentionally placed very fine towards third man, who runs round but can't negate the second run
again angled down to third man, easy runs
straighter this time, and Morgan pushes the ball firmly towards point
back of a length just outside off, feisty delivery but it's chopped down just past the diving backward point fielder for one

Morgan didn't know too much about that one, but they've picked up two! He was aiming to push a length ball into the covers but the ball squirted off the inside edge to midwicket. Acres of space out there, and sharp running brings a second run
Tait keeps Morgan on the back foot, as he defends into the off side
slower one, but he's picked it and drops the ball to cover for a sharp single. Good call, Strauss called him through straight away
more tip-and-run from England, as Strauss this time pushes the ball into the gap at cover
shorter this time, Morgan taps to cover off the back foot, the ball going too quickly to the fielder for any thought of another quick single
tapped to mid off
misses off stump by a whisker! That wasn't too short but Strauss was back into an expansive pull. He was beaten on the under edge and the ball whizzed just past the stumps
short-arm jab down to wide long-on
Morgan beaten on the outside edge this time, as he aims to run the ball down to third man but can't get a touch on it
cutter, slightly slower through the air, and Morgan nudges to midwicket

cheeky, cheeky innovation from Morgan! He's having fun out there, as he shuffles right across to off and sets himself for the Dilscoop, getting the ball away to the fine leg boundary but he tumbled over in the process!
ooh, that could've been nasty! This one slips out of the hand and ends up a beamer, but way outside off. Tait raises his hand in apology
on a length outside off, pushed out to deep cover
bouncer, Morgan ducks quickly underneath it as the ball leaps over the leg stump line
bounce and carry from Tait! That wasn't too short at all, but just leapt up off a length to beat the bat by a good few inches. Paine takes it over his head
much fuller this time, Morgan is rushed somewhat in the drive, and the ball rolls to cover

beaten for pace on the pull this time. Again, it wasn't too short but it got up to chest height. Morgan went for the pull but the ball was on to him too quickly and squirted off the toe of the bat to the off side
flung well wide of off stump, that's a big wide
sharp finish, again back of a length and Morgan hops as he nudges to midwicket
full and driven to mid-off
paddle-swept nicely down to fine leg. He was thinking about the reverse-sweep there, but changed his mind when he picked up the line
pushed out to point and they take a quick single
there's some turn for Smith as he pitches one in the rough outside off, but Morgan is well forward to smother it
sharp turn again! But this one is just too short, and with the field spread Morgan is in no trouble pushing the ball in the air out to midwicket
couple of steps down the track, and nudged to the on side
round the wicket and driven square off the back foot to deep point...brings up the fifty stand
runs this down to third man...Morgan again in full control
worked off the stumps to the left of midwicket
misses a flick to the leg side and is taken on the pad
driven on the up square to point
that's an effortless drive from Morgan, was very full outside off and he placed it perfectly through the covers with timing to beat the sweeper
down the pitch and worked out to midwicket
spins in towards off stump, defended back to the bowler
brings out a reverse hack, not really Strauss's shot and it dribbles to short third-man
well, out of nowhere really Morgan has given his innings away rather tame pull to midwicket...soft way to go, but it shouldn't make a difference to the result
onto the front foot, pushed square on the off side
uses his feet and clips it nicely down the ground
goes for the pull, doesn't time it out to deep square
finds the outside edge but virtually rolls along the ground to the keeper
worked from off stump down to mid on
opens the face and collects a single to third man...this a chance for Yardy to get a nice not out
gone...no century for Strauss as he drives slightly flat-footed outside off and gets a thick edge low to Tim Paine
forced off the back foot to point
worked from outside off with the spin down to long on
flicked straight to midwicket
gone! Well that's a brainless shot from Wright as he tries to clear long off and ends up just giving simple catch to James Hopes. England making it hard work for themselves
comes a long way across his crease, exposes all the stumps but gets a little tickle down to fine leg
pushed back to the bowler
worked with the spin out to midwicket
wow, almost strikes with a fearsome short ball that leaps at Bresnan, takes the shoulder of the bat but falls just out of reach of a diving backward point
wide full toss outside and driven out to the cover sweeper
goes full this time, swinging in towards middle stump but met with a full face to mid on
another full, swinging yorker which he digs out right by his feet and they scamper a well-judged single
but wickets are an issue! Yardy goes as he chases a full one outside off and gets a thin edge through to Paine. Game on. He hit the ground at the same time, but certainly bat there too
play and miss outside off, a full ball swings past Swann's drive and Paine can't gather cleaning...Swann only realises late on there's a bye to be taken
full outside off, driven square down to third man...and Ponting had too many men outside the circle so it's a no-ball, too, but no free hit
driven straight cover
full and searching for swing, driven down to mid off
that's a beauty, pitches outside off and beats Bresnan's nervous poke through to the keeper...a cracking delivery
width outside off and driven hard down to third man
huge appeal for lbw! Bollinger was convinced but I think Swann got his foot outside off stump when he was struck on the boot
flicked from middle stump down to mid on
down the leg side, Swann goes for a pull but doesn't make contact but it's not called wide
late swing that beats Swann's drive again and the pace is still up there...danger time for Swann here who likes to play his shots
targets another yorker and comes out a low full toss which is bunted straight to mid on
another huge appeal from Australia, this time as Swann ducks under a bouncer but the umpire says it came off the arm guard
full into the pads and into the leg side
on a length, takes the thigh pad into square leg and Swann keeps the strike
GONE! What drama, Bollinger from around the wicket gets one through Swann's defence and crashes into middle stump
play and miss first ball! Goes for a drive but it was a half-hearted effort...well bowled
goes for another flamboyant drive...there is no need for that and is so lucky not to get an outside edge
goes for the full, swinging yorker and it's turned out to midwicket
that's a cracker on off stump that lifts past Broad's outside edge...he doesn't look in any sort of form
GONE...stunning stuff from Bollinger as he spears a great yorker through Broad who didn't really look like he had a clue out there today
full on the stumps and heaved away through the leg side to huge cheers from the crowd
full outside off and driven one handed into the covers...can't get any there
low full toss which is slammed straight back to Harris...looks like Bresnan feels he has to do this himself
brilliant stuff from Harris, full on off stump and Bresnan can only jab to cover
boundary...what a time for it as Bresnan gives himself a touch of room and launches this high over extra cover with enough force to find the rope
and now Bresnan keeps the strike as he drives a single to mid off on the edge of the ring
he's done it...leans back and scythes an edge through the vacant third man area, past the man inside the circle. England celebrate as they secure the series but, boy, they made it tough
